This course is aimed mainly at health professionals, especially physicians and aspiring physicians who are responsible for filling out death certificates. The course is also useful for public health professionals who are interested in vital statistics. 

The objective is to teach physicians and health practitioners how to fill out a death certificate while strengthening vital statistics to support public health policies, aimed at improving people’s health.  

This app is the first-of-its-kind. The content was developed by the Pan American Health Organization/World Health Organization, through the Latin American and Caribbean Network for Strengthening Health Information Systems (RELACSIS) with the technical support of the Collaborating Centers for the WHO Family of International Classifications in Mexico (CEMECE) and Argentina (CACE) and the Ministry of Public Health of Uruguay.

This self-paced app provides everything physicians need to know to properly fill out the cause of death on a death certificate, given the legal, medical, and statistical importance of having a correct completed certificate.

By the end of the course, the student will be able to correctly fill out a death certificate in accordance with international standards established by the World Health Organization (WHO), while taking into account national standards  (legislation, time frames, responsibilities, format).

A certificate of completion is issued by PAHO/WHO upon successfully passing the exam.

title.label: Curso Certificado Defunción - Pan American Health Organization

Clinix is a medical application that makes online medicine available to the people that need professional medical consultations in Paraguay.

What is our mission?

We want to make healthcare accessible and convenient to everyone, no matter if you live in a city or in the countryside.

How does it work?

Clinix is a mobile application that you can install on your phone or tablet to book appointments whenever it's convenient to you.

What can we help with?

We have doctors of different specialities that can help treat a variety of symptoms, such as:
– Allergies
– Cough
– Fever
– Insect bites
– Skin rashes
– Sleep disorders
– Headache
... and many more.

How do we conduct appointments?

– Live video chat
Speak 1-on-1 with your doctor in the live video chat
– Online chat for exchanging messages
You can also share messages and files during your video call with the doctor.
– Questionnaire
Provide a doctor with the initial information about your condition.

How do we verify doctors?

We have a strict interview process with all doctors that join Clinix to verify their educational level and qualification. Of course only licensed medical specialists are practicing on the platform.

What happens after the appointment?

After the appointment, the doctor will add a note with a detailed description of your condition and one or several diagnoses. The note will include a treatment plan and if applicable, a medicine prescription.

Features- 

- Record systolic, diastolic blood pressure, pulse rate and weight. Body mass index (BMI), pulse pressure (PP) and mean arterial pressure (MAP) is automatically calculated. Pill Reminder is an easy-to-use and reliable app that helps you remember to take your medications at the right time. It allows you to create any type of recurring reminders (every X hours, specific times, daily, weekly, monthly, every X days, etc). It tracks the remaining quantity of each medication and shows a refill alert when running low.

It has everything you need:

• Mark Medications as Taken or Missed
• Reschedule Medications
• Refill Reminders
• PRN (as needed) Medications
• Calendar
• Reminders for Medical Appointments
• Email Reports to your Doctor
• Multiple User Support

By remembering to take all of your medications at the right time, you are taking control of your own health.


RECURRING REMINDERS
• Repeat every X hours (e.g. From 8 AM to 8 PM, every 4 hours)
• Repeat at specific times (e.g. 9:15 AM, 1:30 PM, 8:50 PM)
• Repeat every half hour (e.g. From 10 AM to 2 PM, every 30 minutes)
• Repeat on selected days of the week (e.g. Every week only on Mondays and Fridays)
• Repeat every X days, weeks or months (e.g. Every 3 days, Every 2 weeks)
• Repeat daily for 21 days and then take 7 days off (Birth Control)

MAIN FEATURES
• User friendly interface
• If you took your medication early or late, you can reschedule the next doses in that day

• Has a calendar to view all reminders by month
• Backup and restore all data on the same device or multiple devices
• 33 built-in alarm sounds

GENERAL

FREE VERSION

The application is based on the scientific research. It helps to determine the fertile days of the month, so you can either achieve or avoid pregnancy. The application uses the date of the last period and shows the date of the next period, the best days to conceive a baby, the ovulation day and when you can avoid pregnancy.

* Scientific Research *

The popular baby gender prediction method is used by default. But it’s based only on the widely-spread theory by Landrum Shettles. The application also supports the scientific baby gender prediction method. It’s based on the scientific research by Rodrigo Guerrero and the statistics of thousands of women.

You can change the gender prediction method on the “Settings” screen. But remember that either gender prediction method shows only slightly higher chances of conceiving a girl or a boy and it never guarantees the result.

* Full Version *

This is the full version of the application. You will be able to see the following data:

- The probability of getting pregnant on the current or on any selected day.
- The probability of conceiving a girl or a boy using the selected gender prediction method.
- Chances of getting pregnant during the current period.
- Chances of conceiving a girl or a boy during the current period.

* How to Use *

To generate the menstrual calendar you have to provide the following data:

- The first day of the last cycle (select the day and use the button “Add”).
- Average length of the menstrual cycle (adjust it on the “Settings” screen).
- Length of the luteal phase (most women can use the default value).

The application works best for women with regular menstrual cycle. But average cycle length is also a good way to predict when the ovulation should happen.

Therefore people should check their values regularly and keep the data in a blood pressure log.

At the end of 2021 we finally wanted to take high blood pressure management more seriously ourselves and started developing a smart blood pressure app:

My Blood Pressure Tracker.

2º SELECCIONA EL FÁRMACO
Puedes seleccionar uno de los medicamentos y también puedes escribir el nombre del fármaco o del principio activo en el buscador.

3º CONSULTA LA INDICACIÓN PARA CADA PESO
DosisPedia incluye un sistema que calcula automáticamente la dosis a administrar al paciente en función del peso.
Pulsa la ficha del fármaco que quieras consultar y aparecerá la barra de pesos. Mueve la barra y busca el peso de tu paciente. DosisPedia te sugiere la dosis para ese peso. Además podrás consultar las indicaciones generales del fármaco: vía de administración, posología y presentación.

CARACTERÍSTICAS
- Sección Emergencias: Dosis calculadas según el peso del niño para procesos de urgencia vital, patologías urgentes y emergencias sanitarias pediátricas.

- Buscador de medicamentos: Un buscador avanzado permite encontrar medicamentos en tiempo real a partir del nombre del fármaco o del principio activo.
- Calculadora de dosis por peso: Un selector permite ajustar el peso del paciente para consultar dinámicamente las indicaciones y la dosis adecuada a suministrar.
- Avisos y comentarios: Las fichas de los medicamentos incluyen advertencias, precauciones, contraindicaciones, interacciones medicamentosas y posibles reacciones adversas.
- Medicamentos actualizados: Actualizaciones periódicas de fármacos en la app. Inclusión de nuevos fármacos, ampliación de especificaciones de dosis.

DOSISPEDIA, APP MÉDICA DE REFERENCIA.
DosisPedia es una aplicación médica de dosificación pediátrica para la ayuda en consulta y urgencias. Esta farmacopea es el vademécum gratis en español de referencia médica y farmacológica para especialistas que atienden niños; se posiciona desde el año 2016 en el Top 10 de la categoría Medicina en el App Store, en España y en varios países de América Latina como México, Colombia, Perú, Argentina o Venezuela.

FIND OUT YOUR RISK OF HEART DISEASE AND HOW TO LOWER IT

This FREE app is a cardiovascular risk calculator that estimates the possible 10-year risk of myocardial infarction, stroke, or cardiovascular death. It includes the six regions of the Americas (Andean, Caribbean, Central, North, South, and Tropical) according to tables published in 2019 by the World Health Organization (WHO) (Lancet, 2019). This risk score was based on extensive review of available cohorts and were adapted to 21 global regions based on analysis of the burden of cardiovascular morbidity. For each region, an estimate was published that requires knowing an individual's blood cholesterol level (or other information if the blood cholesterol level is not known). The Pan American Health Organization (PAHO), with the financial contribution of the U.S Centers for Diseases Prevention and Control, transformed the published color-coded tables into an online electronic calculator for use on computers and smartphones, updating the previous Cardiocal app (2014)


Who is this app for?

The calculator is intended to help the health care providers quickly calculate cardiovascular risk and discuss with patients the extent to which their risk can be reduced. It also aims to help people concerned about their health, making it easier for them to estimate the need for a medical consultation when their risk is not low. The treatment recommendations are oriented to the assisting professionals and do not constitute a guide to self-medication, which can be dangerous. Under no circumstances is this calculator intended as a replacement for medical consultation or a clinical judgment.

Features

» Click on the gear icon to choose a country. Each country belongs to one of the six regions mentioned above, and the risk calculation will give different results.

» You can change the language (English, Spanish, or Portuguese), cholesterol unit (mmol/L or mg/dl), and metric or imperial units (cm or feet and inches).

» The app includes country-specific protocols for the 12 countries whose health ministries have defined standardized protocols for the treatment of hypertension.

The application is based on the scientific research. It helps to determine the fertile days of the month, so you can either achieve or avoid pregnancy. The application uses the date of the last period and shows the date of the next period, the best days to conceive a baby, the ovulation day and when you can avoid pregnancy.

* Scientific Research *

The popular baby gender prediction method is used by default. But it’s based only on the widely-spread theory by Landrum Shettles. The application also supports the scientific baby gender prediction method. It’s based on the scientific research by Rodrigo Guerrero and the statistics of thousands of women.

You can change the gender prediction method on the “Settings” screen. But remember that either gender prediction method shows only slightly higher chances of conceiving a girl or a boy and it never guarantees the result.

* Full Version *

This is the full version of the application. You will be able to see the following data:

- The probability of getting pregnant on the current or on any selected day.
- The probability of conceiving a girl or a boy using the selected gender prediction method.
- Chances of getting pregnant during the current period.
- Chances of conceiving a girl or a boy during the current period.

* How to Use *

To generate the menstrual calendar you have to provide the following data:

- The first day of the last cycle (select the day and use the button “Add”).
- Average length of the menstrual cycle (adjust it on the “Settings” screen).
- Length of the luteal phase (most women can use the default value).

The application works best for women with regular menstrual cycle. But average cycle length is also a good way to predict when the ovulation should happen.

The Diabetes Test is a complex and precise risk calculator for developing diabetes mellitus. Using a combination of multiple test algorithms, we developed the test, which consider a wide range of factors and is able to recognize smaller nuances than any other risk calculator. After completing a brief questionnaire, you would quickly discover your potential risk of developing this chronic disease in the next 10 years.  This user-friendly application excels in its simplicity of use and is a great aid for those who care about their health. 

You just enter the information of your age, gender, family anamnesis, physical condition, BMI, and other factors into your mobile phone.
 
Diabetes mellitus represents one of the most frequent civilization diseases. Two basic types  are recognized: type 1 diabetes and  type 2 diabetes, which both develop due to an absolute or relative deficit of insulin. The diabetic thus cannot use his/her own blood glucose, which leads to increased blood sugar and other serious health consequences.
 
Do not let diabetes take control over your life. Find out the possible risk of developing this disease and adopt the possible preventive measures in time.  Modern medicine is able to cure this disease.

The right kinds of lower back exercises will help recovery from back pain.

Back pain is common but most cases aren’t caused by a serious problem. Most cases of back pain get better on their own within a few weeks.

Stay active. Bed rest for more than a couple of days makes it harder to get going. Gradually increase your normal activities and do regular exercise.

When done in a controlled, progressive manner, exercises for relieving back pain have many benefits, including:
- Strengthening the muscles that support the spine, removing pressure from the spinal discs and facet joints
- Alleviating stiffness and improving mobility
- Improving circulation to better distribute nutrients through the body, including to the spinal discs
- Releasing endorphins, which can naturally relieve pain. A frequent release of endorphins can help reduce reliance on pain medication. -
 Endorphins can also elevate mood and relieve depressive symptoms, a common effect of chronic pain.
- Minimizing the frequency of back or neck pain episodes, and reducing the severity of pain when it does occur

Your core muscles support your spine and lower back, and your core, hips, glutes, and hamstrings together form one big stability machine, so weakness in any one of those muscles forces the others to take up the slack. If you have weak hip and gluteal muscles, for example, as they become fatigued during a run, your lower back is forced to work harder to keep you upright and stable, and you become vulnerable to injury.

Desde Enero del 2015 el Área de Salud de Menorca, Baleares, forma parte  del  proyecto de Centros Comprometidos con la Excelencia  en Cuidados (BPSO, Best Practice Spotlight Organization) con el soporte de INVESTEN- ISCIII, con el objetivo de  implantar, entre otras,  la “Guía de Buenas Prácticas” (GBP) de la asociación de enfermeras de Ontario (RNAO) “Valoración y selección de dispositivos de acceso vascular”La terapia intravenosa tiene por finalidad utilizar una vía venosa con fines terapéuticos, limitando las complicaciones y obteniendo el máximo rendimiento. Es un procedimiento enfermero cuyas intervenciones quedan reflejadas en la Clasificación de Intervenciones de Enfermería -NIC- Con objeto de reducir las complicaciones asociadas a la terapia intravenosa y de conseguir el mayor beneficio terapéutico, Enfermería debe tener en cuenta algunas consideraciones:En primer lugar, que para administrar cualquier tipo de tratamiento intravenoso es necesario puncionar una vena, mediante aguja, en una zona anatómica que debe ser seleccionada en función del tratamiento indicado y de las características y preferencias del paciente.En segundo lugar, que la terapia intravenosa implica la correcta administración de las soluciones o fármacos prescritos.En tercer lugar, que las complicaciones asociadas a la terapia intravenosa pueden reducirse considerablemente aplicando cuidados de calidad sobre el punto de inserción,  la piel,  el catéter y los equipos de infusión.Por último, que la terapia intravenosa también lleva asociada la observancia estricta de cuidados destinados no sólo a controlar la infección sino también a proteger al enfermo frente a la misma.App Terapia IV(Terapia Intravenosa) Los enfermeros impulsores de la implantación de la GBP en el Hospital Mateu Orfila de Maó, Menorca, hemos diseñado esta aplicación para dispositivos móviles (App) como herramienta facilitadora en la implantación de la GBP.Incluye contenidos que diseñó el grupo de impulsores durante los primeros meses de implantación (algoritmo de decisión, circuito de solicitud de CVC, protocolos actualizados, interconsulta de enfermería, listado de fármacos con pH y osmolaridad) y enlaces a páginas de interés en terapia intravenosa. Creemos que el uso de esta App nos permitirá lllevar la evidencia científica a “pie de cama” y será una herramienta de gran utilidad para los enfermeros y enfermeras. Toda sugerencia será bienvenida.Contacto: guiadav@hgmo.es

Blood pressure monitor & heart rate tracker app - Our application does not measure blood pressure. The app allows you to track it. For measurement use, FDA-approved blood pressure monitors.

App Main Features:
 
- Modern and user-friendly interface
- High blood pressure control
- Clear graphs
- Measurement history
- Reminders and notifications

Blood Pressure Levels:

Normal: Systolic 90-119 and Diastolic 60-79
Hypotension: Systolic 90 and less or Diastolic 60 and less
Elevated: Systolic 120-129 and Diastolic 60-80
Hypertension - Stage 1: Systolic 130-139 or Diastolic 80-90
Hypertension - Stage 2: Systolic 140-180 or Diastolic 90-120
Hypertensive: Systolic 180 and higher or Diastolic 120 and higher

Aging Adults:

In adults, systolic blood pressure rises from early adulthood onward, up to at least age 70. Diastolic pressure tends to begin to rise at the same time but starts to fall earlier in mid-life, approximately age 55. Mean blood pressure rises from early adulthood, plateauing in mid-life, while pulse pressure rises quite markedly after the age of 40.

Consequently, in many older people, systolic blood pressure often exceeds the normal adult range. The rise in pulse pressure with age is attributed to increased stiffness of the arteries.

• Calcule el filtrado glomerular estimado, la escala Child-Pugh, la escala MELD y otros parámetros relevantes para la elección del antibiótico, dosis e intervalo de administración.
• Toque sobre la bibliografía para acceder al original en PubMed.
• Disponga siempre de la información más reciente y completa. El contenido está en permanente revisión en función de la evolución de las tasas de resistencia, la aparición de nuevos microorganismos, los cambios epidemiológicos, la inclusión en terapéutica de nuevos antimicrobianos y las publicaciones de revisiones o consensos de tratamiento en las revistas más prestigiosas de la especialidad. Asimismo, se prevé la inclusión de nuevos síndromes y nuevas herramientas y apartados (vacunas, tratamiento más detallado del sida y sus complicaciones, uso de antimicrobianos tópicos, prevención de infecciones en pacientes que reciben biológicos, entre otros).
